resources.string: Are you aware of how the Spanish energy system works?
There are four parts that are crucial for this system to function: Generation, transport, distribution and commercialisation.
The public company in charge of energy transportation is called "Red Electrica de Espa√±a (REE)". The generation and distribution are handled by the spanish energy oligopoly.

These three companies that generate energy pour it into the grid. REE owns and maintains the grid so the distribution can be done. The distributors use this infrastructure so energy can reach the customers through the marketers.

The daily energy market is called the pool, and It is the place where the marketers (most of them belong to the three big producers) buy energy from the producers estimating how much energy is needed at each hour of the day.

The energy market works in a marginalist way. This way of commercialisation endorses efficient and greener generation techniques. At the moment, this system turns to be quite profitable for the producers, because the customers pay each one of the kilowatts they buy at the higher cost (the cassation cost), which is fixed by the three oligopolistic companies that run the spanish grid.
